intro: Heliotropium ellipticum, commonly known as the narrowleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical in shape, hence the species name, and its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in summer. Heliotropium ellipticum is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife.
